content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: high school & math memory

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy but why not ? I have to search the formula on Google for me :-)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good for beginners to help them with arithmetic signs

The sentences may need a little grammar check ("compute the area of a trapezoid", "In the first line, you have {{a}}, the length of the short base", etc.)
The input/output descriptions seem too vague: is there a maximum? Can the inputs be float? How many digits should I print after the decimal point? Should the result be rounded?

Hello, first, pay attention to spelling mistakes: "the", capital letters... Then, be clearer in your inputs/outputs, the documentation will be able to help you. Finally, the statement seems to me a bit difficult to find in mode without statement, this mode should perhaps be discarded. Remember: don't confuse speed with haste, too much precision is better than lack of information. Otherwise, it's a good little challenge, just a few changes are missing.

Yes, I generally agree with your comments. And "this mode" in your comment refers to "reverse mode", right?

Additional comment: 2 variables refer to "first base" in Input section, which is wrong.
Yes, I was talking of "reverse mode", and the bases names should be the "long base" and the "short base", it would be clearer in my opinion.
